verses.verse: And the temple which I build will be great, for (Ps. 135:5; (1 Cor. 8:5, 6)) our God is greater than all gods.

(1 Kin. 8:27; 2 Chr. 6:18; Is. 66:1) But who is able to build Him a temple, since heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain Him? Who am I then, that I should build Him a temple, except to burn sacrifice before Him?

Therefore send me at once a man skillful to work in gold and silver, in bronze and iron, in purple and crimson and blue, who has skill to engrave with the skillful men who are with me in Judah and Jerusalem, (1 Chr. 22:15) whom David my father provided.
(1 Kin. 5:6) Also send me cedar and cypress and algum logs from Lebanon, for I know that your servants have skill to cut timber in Lebanon; and indeed my servants will be with your servants,
to prepare timber for me in abundance, for the temple which I am about to build shall be great and wonderful.

(1 Kin. 5:11) And indeed I will give to your servants, the woodsmen who cut timber, twenty thousand kors of ground wheat, twenty thousand kors of barley, twenty thousand baths of wine, and twenty thousand baths of oil.
Then Hiram king of Tyre answered in writing, which he sent to Solomon: (1 Kin. 10:9; 2 Chr. 9:8) Because the LORD loves His people, He has made you king over them.

Hiram also said: (1 Kin. 5:7) Blessed be the LORD God of Israel, (Gen. 1; 2; Acts 4:24; 14:15; Rev. 10:6) who made heaven and earth, for He has given King David a wise son, endowed with prudence and understanding, who will build a temple for the LORD and a royal house for himself!
And now I have sent a skillful man, endowed with understanding, Huram my master craftsman

(1 Kin. 7:13, 14) (the son of a woman of the daughters of Dan, and his father was a man of Tyre), skilled to work in gold and silver, bronze and iron, stone and wood, purple and blue, fine linen and crimson, and to make any engraving and to accomplish any plan which may be given to him, with your skillful men and with the skillful men of my lord David your father.
Now therefore, the wheat, the barley, the oil, and the wine which (2 Chr. 2:10) my lord has spoken of, let him send to his servants.
(1 Kin. 5:8, 9) And we will cut wood from Lebanon, as much as you need; we will bring it to you in rafts by sea to Joppa, and you will carry it up to Jerusalem.

(1 Kin. 5:13; 2 Chr. 8:7, 8) Then Solomon numbered all the aliens who were in the land of Israel, after the census in which (1 Chr. 22:2) David his father had numbered them; and there were found to be one hundred and fifty-three thousand six hundred.
And he made (2 Chr. 2:2) seventy thousand of them bearers of burdens, eighty thousand stonecutters in the mountain, and three thousand six hundred overseers to make the people work.

(Solomon Builds the Temple) Now (1 Kin. 6:1) Solomon began to build the house of the LORD at (Gen. 22:2-14) Jerusalem on Mount Moriah, where the LORD had appeared to his father David, at the place that David had prepared on the threshing floor of (1 Chr. 21:18; 22:1) Ornan the Jebusite.
And he began to build on the second day of the second month in the fourth year of his reign.

This is the foundation (1 Kin. 6:2; 1 Chr. 28:11-19) which Solomon laid for building the house of God: The length was sixty cubits (by cubits according to the former measure) and the width twenty cubits.
